main event: On September 8, 1961, a bright light was observed by multiple witnesses in the sky over Lincoln, New Hampshire. The object displayed erratic movements and was estimated to be 30-40 feet in diameter.
interesting points: The object was described as luminous and circular, moving slowly and later accelerating out of sight., Witness reports mentioned a pulsating light changing colors., One witness observed the object for approximately 20 minutes., The Air Force concluded that the sighting was possibly a star or planet affected by atmospheric conditions., No physical evidence or photographs were obtained during the investigation.
witness description: Witnesses included a retired Air Force officer and other local residents.
